main event: A civilian observed a star-like object emitting a reddish-orange glow in the sky over Columbia, Missouri in July 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for 2-3 minutes and was nearly stationary,The object had an estimated altitude of 10,000 feet and was circular in shape,No sound was heard during the observation,The observation started at 01:46 GMT and ended at 01:49 GMT when the object disappeared,The sighting was recorded in Project Blue Book as part of investigation number 10073.
sighted object: a circular star-like object emitting a reddish-orange glow
